intro: Brachyscome mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican daisy, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy, daisy-like yellow flowers with white centers, typically blooming in spring and early summer. It has a compact growth habit with hairy, gray-green leaves that help reduce water loss. Brachyscome mexicana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
